params.name: options
params.doc: Options for updating multiple draft posts.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for creating a draft post.

description: The draft post's `memberId` is required for third-party apps.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for deleting a draft post.

docs.summary:
Moves a draft post with the provided ID to the trash bin.
A published post can also be deleted by its provided `draftPostId`.
description: The optional `permanent` field enables you to delete a post permanently, bypassing the trash bin. When a draft post is deleted this way, it can't be restored.

docs.summary: Gets a deleted draft post from the trash bin by the provided ID.
description: Uses the provided `draftPostId` to retrieve a previously deleted draft post from the trash bin.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for getting a draft post.

docs.summary: Gets a draft post by the provided ID.
description: Uses the provided `draftPostId` to retrieve a draft post.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for listing deleted draft posts.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 deleted draft posts.
description:
List Deleted Draft Posts runs with these defaults, which you can override:
- `editedDate` is sorted in descending order. In this case,`editedDate` implies the date the post was deleted.
- `paging.limit` is `50`.
- `paging.offset` is `0`.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for listing multiple draft posts.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 draft posts per request.
description:
List Draft Posts runs with these defaults, which you can override:
- `editedDate` is sorted in descending order.
- `paging.limit` is `50`.
- `paging.offset` is `0`.

docs.summary: Publishes a specified draft post by ID. This creates a new post entity with the data from the draft post.
description: If the specified draft post was already published, the published post will be updated with the latest values from the draft post entity.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 draft posts, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting.
description: Query Draft Posts runs with these defaults, which you can override:

docs.summary: Permanently deletes a draft post by the provided ID from the trash bin.
description: Uses the provided `draftPostId` to permanently delete a draft post from the trash bin. This action is permanent and cannot be reversed.

docs.summary: Restores a deleted draft post from the trash bin by the provided ID.
description: Uses the `draftPostId` to restore a deleted draft post from the trash bin.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for updating a draft post.

examples.title: updateDraftPost example
body: const result = await draftPosts.updateDraftPost(id, draftPost, options);

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of draft post fields to be included in the response if the entities are present.
Base default fieldset returns all core draft post properties (all properties that are not a supported fieldset value).
For example,  when `URL` fieldset is selected, returned draft post will include the set of base properties and the draft post's preview url.

members.name: action
members.doc:
Action to perform on the posts.

- `UPDATE`: Update the draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLISH`: Update and publish the draft post.
- `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and schedule a publish date.
- `UPDATE_REVERT_TO_DRAFT`: Update the post and revert it to a draft post.
- `UPDATE_CANCEL_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and cancel the scheduled publish date.
- `UPDATE_REJECT`: Update and reject the draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLICATION`: Update a published post. This creates and updates a draft version of the post. The original post is still published.

Default: `UPDATE`

members.name: draftPosts
members.doc: Draft posts to update.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of additional draft post fields to include in the response. For example, use the `URL` fieldset to retrieve the url field in
the response in addition to the draft post's base fields. Base fields don’t include any of the supported fieldset values. By default
only the draft post's base fields are returned.

members.name: returnFullEntity
members.doc: Whether to return the full updated draft post entities in the response.

members.name: scheduledPublishDate
members.doc: Posts' scheduled publish date when `action` is set to `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`.

members.name: action
members.doc:
Action to perform on the posts.

- `UPDATE`: Update the draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLISH`: Update and publish the draft post.
- `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and schedule a publish date.
- `UPDATE_REVERT_TO_DRAFT`: Update the post and revert it to a draft post.
- `UPDATE_CANCEL_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and cancel the scheduled publish date.
- `UPDATE_REJECT`: Update and reject the draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLICATION`: Update a published post. This creates and updates a draft version of the post. The original post is still published.

Default: `UPDATE`

members.doc: Draft posts to update.

List of additional draft post fields to include in the response. For example, use the `URL` fieldset to retrieve the url field in
the response in addition to the draft post's base fields. Base fields don’t include any of the supported fieldset values. By default
only the draft post's base fields are returned.

members.name: returnFullEntity

members.name: scheduledPublishDate
members.doc: Posts' scheduled publish date when `action` is set to `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`.

members.name: displayPosition
members.doc:
Category position in sequence. Categories with a lower display position are displayed first. Categories with a position of `-1` appear at the end of the sequence.

Default: `-1`

members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

Category position in sequence.

members.name: groupBy
members.doc:
Group results by fields (defaults to grouping by status).
If, for example, grouping by language is passed, language values in response will be filled.
If, for example, grouping by language is not passed, null values will be filled in language field in response.

members.name: language
members.doc: Optional language filter by provided language code. Useful in multilingual context.

members.name: groupBy
members.doc:
Group results by fields (defaults to grouping by status).
If, for example, grouping by language is passed, language values in response will be filled.
If, for example, grouping by language is not passed, null values will be filled in language field in response.

members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: crop

members.doc: The number of columns to display on mobile screens.

members.doc: The number of columns to display on full size screens.

members.name: anchor
members.doc: The target node's ID. Used for linking to another node in this object.

members.name: customData
members.doc: A serialized object used for a custom or external link panel.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

members.name: target
members.doc:
The HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the linked document.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of additional draft post fields to include in the response. For example, use the `URL` fieldset to retrieve the url field in
the response in addition to the draft post's base fields. Base fields don’t include any of the supported fieldset values. By default
only the draft post's base fields are returned.

members.name: language
members.doc:
Language filter.

2-letter language code in [ISO 639-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) format.
If omitted, deleted draft posts in all languages are returned.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sorting options.

- `EDITING_DATE_ASC`: `editedDate` in ascending order.
- `EDITING_DATE_DESC`: `editedDate` in descending order.

Default: `EDITING_DATE_DESCENDING`

members.doc:
Draft post status filter.

If omitted, draft posts with all statuses are returned.

the response in addition to the draft post's base fields. Base fields don’t include any of the supported fieldset values. By default

members.doc: The height of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailWidth`must also be defined.

members.doc: The URL for a thumbnail image for the resource. If this property is defined, `thumbnailWidth` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.doc: The width of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.doc: Option ID.

members.doc: The image displayed with the option.

members.doc: Option title.

members.doc: Border radius in pixels.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display option images.

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF download button is disabled.

members.name: disablePrint
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF print button is disabled.

members.name: viewMode
members.doc:
PDF view mode. One of the following:
`NONE` : The PDF isn't displayed.
`FULL` : A full page view of the PDF is displayed.
`MINI` : A mini view of the PDF is displayed.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level from 1-6.

members.name: textStyle
members.doc: Styling for the paragraph text.

members.name: allowMultipleVotes
members.doc: Sets whether one voter can vote multiple times.

members.name: view
members.doc: Sets who can view the poll results.

members.name: vote
members.doc: Sets who can vote.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: autoPlay
members.doc: Sets whether the media will automatically start playing.

members.name: playInLoop
members.doc: Sets whether media's will be looped.

members.name: showControls
members.doc: Sets whether media's controls will be shown.

members.name: alignment
members.doc: The node's alignment within its container.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: spoiler
members.doc: Spoiler cover settings for the node.

members.name: textWrap
members.doc: Sets whether text should wrap around this node when it's displayed. If `textWrap` is `false`, the node takes up the width of its container.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: Small width.
`ORIGINAL`: The width of the container matches the original asset width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: Full width.

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protects referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the page’s author. For example, a link in a fourm post.

List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: postId
members.doc: Source post ID.

members.name: draftPost
members.doc: Updated post draft.

members.name: documentStyle
members.doc: Global styling for header, paragraph, block quote, and code block nodes in the object.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Object metadata.

members.name: nodes
members.doc: Node objects representing a rich content document.

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tag information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled.

Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: buttonText
members.doc: The text for the button used to remove the spoiler cover.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description displayed on top of the spoiler cover.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Sets whether the spoiler cover is enabled for this node.

members.name: border
members.doc: Border attributes.

members.name: colors
members.doc: Color attributes.

members.name: borderColors
members.doc: The cell's border colors.

members.name: cellStyle
members.doc: Styling for the cell's background color and text alignment.

members.name: columnHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first column is a header.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the table's container.

members.name: dimensions
members.doc: The table's dimensions.

members.name: header
members.doc: Deprecated: Use `rowHeader` and `columnHeader` instead.

members.name: rowHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first row is a header.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
SEO tag type.

Supported values: `title`, `meta`, `script`, `link`.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply.

members.name: text
members.doc: The text to apply decorations to.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply to the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: Line height for text in the node.

members.name: nodeStyle
members.doc: Padding and background color for the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text as a unitless ratio.

members.name: textAlignment
members.doc: Text alignment. Defaults to `AUTO`.

members.name: placement
members.doc: Thumbnail alignment.

members.name: spacing
members.doc: Spacing between thumbnails in pixels.

members.name: language
members.doc: Draft post language code (only has value when grouping by language, otherwise null).

members.name: status
members.doc: Draft post status (only has value when grouping by status, otherwise null).

members.name: total
members.doc: Draft post totals in that group.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: Source category ID

members.name: language
members.doc: Translation language

members.name: category
members.doc: Translated category

members.name: translations
members.doc: Other translations of returned category

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: language
members.doc: Translation language

members.name: postId
members.doc: Source post or draft ID

members.name: draftPost
members.doc: Draft post.

members.name: draftPostId
members.doc: Draft post ID.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date the draft post was first created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Draft post ID.

members.name: categoryIds
members.doc: Category IDs of the draft post.

members.name: changeOrigin
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: commentingEnabled
members.doc: Whether commenting on the draft post is enabled.

members.name: content
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: contentId
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: editedDate
members.doc: Date the draft post was last edited.

members.name: editingSessionId
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: excerpt
members.doc:
Draft post excerpt.

If no excerpt has been manually set, an excerpt is automatically generated from the post's text.
This can be retrieved using the `GENERATED_EXCERPT` fieldset.

members.name: featured
members.doc: Whether the draft post is marked as featured.

members.name: firstPublishedDate
members.doc: Date the post was first published.

members.name: hasUnpublishedChanges
members.doc: Indicates if there are changes made to the draft post that have not yet been published.

members.name: hashtags
members.doc: Hashtags in the draft post.

members.name: heroImage
members.doc: Image placed at the top of the blog page.

members.name: internalId
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: language
members.doc:
Language the draft post is written in.

2-letter language code in [ISO 639-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) format.

members.name: media
members.doc: Post cover media.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Draft post owner's member ID.

members.name: minutesToRead
members.doc: Estimated reading time of the draft post (calculated automatically).

members.name: moderationDetails
members.doc: Details of the draft post in review. Only relevant to posts submitted by guest writers.

members.name: mostRecentContributorId
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: previewTextParagraph
members.doc: Number of paragraphs to display in a paid content preview for non-paying users.

members.name: pricingPlanIds
members.doc: Pricing plan IDs. Only relevant if a post is assigned to a specific pricing plan.

members.name: relatedPostIds
members.doc: IDs of posts related to this draft post.

members.name: richContent
members.doc: Draft post rich content.

members.name: scheduledPublishDate
members.doc: Date the draft post is scheduled to be published.

members.name: seoData
members.doc: SEO data.

members.name: seoSlug
members.doc: SEO slug.

members.name: slugs
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the draft post.

members.name: tagIds
members.doc: Tag IDs the draft post is tagged with.

members.name: title
members.doc: Draft post title.

members.name: translationId
members.doc:
ID of the draft post's translations.

All translations of a single post share the same `translationId`.
Available only if the [Multilingual](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-multilingual-an-overview) app is installed.

members.name: url
members.doc: Draft post URL preview. What the URL will look like once the post is published.

members.name: changeOrigin
members.doc: Change origin.

members.name: content
members.doc: DraftJs content to update.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: richContent
members.doc: Draft post rich content.

members.name: changeOrigin
members.doc: Change origin.

members.doc: DraftJs content to update.

members.doc: Draft post ID.

List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: richContent
members.doc: Draft post rich content.

members.name: content
members.doc: DraftJs content to update.

members.name: richContent
members.doc: Draft post rich content.

members.name: draftPost
members.doc: Updated draft post info.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of draft post fields to be included if entities are present in the response.
Base fieldset, which is default, will return all core draft post properties.
Example: When URL fieldset is selected, returned draft post will have a set of base properties and draft post preview url.

members.name: language
members.doc: New language to replace to

members.name: postId
members.doc: Source draft post ID

members.name: draftPost
members.doc: Draft post

members.name: action
members.doc:
Action to perform on the post.

- `UPDATE`: Update the draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLISH`: Update and publish a draft post.
- `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and schedule a publish date.
- `UPDATE_REVERT_TO_DRAFT`: Update the post and revert it to draft.
- `UPDATE_CANCEL_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and cancel the scheduled publish date.
- `UPDATE_REJECT`: Update and reject draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLICATION`: Update a post that's already been published. This creates and updates a draft version of the post. The original post is still published.

Default: `UPDATE`

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of additional draft post fields to include in the response. For example, use the `URL` fieldset to retrieve the url field in
the response in addition to the draft post's base fields. Base fields don’t include any of the supported fieldset values. By default
only the draft post's base fields are returned.

members.name: scheduledPublishDate
members.doc: Post publish schedule date if `action` is set to `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`.

members.name: action
members.doc:
Action to perform on the post.

- `UPDATE`: Update the draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLISH`: Update and publish a draft post.
- `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and schedule a publish date.
- `UPDATE_REVERT_TO_DRAFT`: Update the post and revert it to draft.
- `UPDATE_CANCEL_SCHEDULE`: Update the draft post and cancel the scheduled publish date.
- `UPDATE_REJECT`: Update and reject draft post.
- `UPDATE_PUBLICATION`: Update a post that's already been published. This creates and updates a draft version of the post. The original post is still published.

Default: `UPDATE`

members.name: draftPost
members.doc: Draft post to update.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
List of additional draft post fields to include in the response. For example, use the `URL` fieldset to retrieve the url field in
the response in addition to the draft post's base fields. Base fields don’t include any of the supported fieldset values. By default
only the draft post's base fields are returned.

members.name: scheduledPublishDate
members.doc: Post publish schedule date if `action` is set to `UPDATE_SCHEDULE`.

members.name: draftPost
members.doc: Updated draft post info.

members.name: duration
members.doc: Media duration in seconds. Only relevant for audio and video files.

members.name: height
members.doc: Media height in pixels.

members.name: src
members.doc: The source for the media's data.

members.name: width
members.doc: Media width in pixels.

members.name: media
members.doc: Video file details.

members.name: thumbnail
members.doc: Video thumbnail file details.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the video's container.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the video's download button is disabled.

members.name: options
members.doc: Video options.

members.name: thumbnail
members.doc: Video thumbnail details.

members.name: title
members.doc: Video title.

members.name: video
members.doc: Video details.

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.

members.name: height
members.doc: Video height.

members.name: url
members.doc: Video URL.

members.name: width
members.doc: Video width.

members.name: image
members.doc: Thumbnail or image details. Required if videoV2 is provided.

members.name: videoV2
members.doc: Video details. Optional
